sen.j: 武徳殿（ぶとくでん）は、平安時代、大内裏にあった殿舎のひとつ。
sen.e: Butokuden (武徳殿) is one of those palace buildings that used be in Daidairi (the Greater Imperial Palace including the government buildings) in the Heian period.
Butokuden (武徳殿) is one of the palace buildings that used be in Daidairi (the Greater Imperial Palace including the government buildings) in the Heian Period.
Butokuden is one of the palace buildings that used be in Daidairi (the Greater Imperial Palace including the government buildings) in the Heian period.

sen.j: 宮中で競馬などを観覧する際に用いられた。
sen.e: It was used to watch horse racings in the Palace.
It was used to watch horse racing in the Palace.
It was used to watch horse racing in the Palace.

sen.j: 大内裏の西方に位置し、右近衛府、右兵衛府の間を通り、殷富門に面していた。
sen.e: It was located in the west of Daidairi facing the Inbu-mon Gate that was between the buildings of Ukonoefu (the palace police) and Uhyoefu (the gate guard).
It was located in the west of Daidairi facing the Inbu-mon Gate, between the buildings of Ukonoefu (the palace police) and Uhyoefu (the gate guard).
It was located in the west of Daidairi facing the Inbu-mon Gate, between the buildings of Ukonoefu (the palace police) and Uhyoefu (Right Division of Middle Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 武徳殿の東は馬場、宴の松原などが広がっていた。
sen.e: At the east side of Butokuden, there was an open space containing a horse riding ground and Ennomaubara Field (a field with pine trees).
At the east side of Butokuden, there was an open space containing a horse riding ground and Ennomaubara Field (a field with pine trees).
At the east side of Butokuden, there was an open space containing a horse riding ground and Ennomatsubara Field (a field with pine trees).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 後に明治の大日本武徳会の武術（日本武術）・武道の本部及び全国各地（外地含む）の道場、についても上記にちなんで武徳殿と称された。
sen.e: The headquarters of Dai Nippon Butoku Kai (a martial arts organization) for Japanese martial arts, and other training halls of martial arts across the country especially in the Meiji period (including ones overseas) were also called Butokuden after the one in the Daidairi.

The headquarters of Dai Nippon Butoku Kai (a martial arts organization) for Japanese martial arts, and other martial arts training halls across the country, especially those founded in the Meiji Period (including ones overseas) were also called Butokuden after the one in the Daidairi.

The headquarters of Dai Nippon Butoku Kai (a martial arts organization) for Japanese martial arts, and other martial arts training halls across the country, especially those founded in the Meiji period (including ones overseas) were also called Butokuden after the one in the Daidairi.

sen.j: 武道を奨励された当時の建築だけに現存するものは文化財としての価値が高いものがある。
sen.e: Because they were built to promote martial arts at that time, those buildings that remain today are valued as cultural properties.
Because they were built to promote martial arts at that time any such buildings that remain today are valued as cultural properties.
Because they were built to promote martial arts at that time any such buildings that remain today are valued as cultural properties.
